pullrequest.title: add support for keyboard teleop the hands

content.raw:
And some fixes and changed mapping to make the keys map more naturally to the fingers. Worked fine for me.

For further feature we might need keyboards with more keys :wink:

pullrequest.title: add support for keyboard teleop the hands

content.raw:
I wonder if we want to put the hand control in a separate script, perhaps in the `val_grasping` repository? That would relieve some of the keyboard pressure.

An alternative is to add the `val_grasping` controller to `srcsim`, but it is closer to a reference controller and is not required, while the ihmc walking and arm controllers are required.
content.html:
I wonder if we want to put the hand control in a separate script, perhaps in the val_grasping repository? That would relieve some of the keyboard pressure.

An alternative is to add the val_grasping controller to srcsim, but it is closer to a reference controller and is not required, while the ihmc walking and arm controllers are required.

pullrequest.title: add support for keyboard teleop the hands

content.raw:
This is fixed by reducing some of the controller gains in `val_description`. I have an open pull request to fix it upstream:

* https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/val_description/merge_requests/16

The following urdf has these fixes already; just find the right place to put it in `/opt/nasa` while we wait for new debs to be built.

* https://gist.github.com/scpeters/066b1445ba5de374dfaebf191711a013
content.html:
This is fixed by reducing some of the controller gains in val_description. I have an open pull request to fix it upstream:

  • https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/val_description/merge_requests/16

The following urdf has these fixes already; just find the right place to put it in /opt/nasa while we wait for new debs to be built.

  • https://gist.github.com/scpeters/066b1445ba5de374dfaebf191711a013

pullrequest.title: add support for keyboard teleop the hands

content.raw:
I just added #!/osrf/srcsim/commits/f26c59447b63234fcefcbf9f04d674f0cc502873?at=default to print the list of topics being waited on repeatedly. It helped with debugging when some topics are available.

This works for me when using #!/osrf/srcsim/pull-requests/51/add-val_grasping-controller-to-srcsim/diff I updated the wiki page to include the flag to enable the grasping controller: #!/osrf/srcsim/wiki/commits/ed837098bb029fe7ba907dd9fbd71a69647adc8c
content.html:

pullrequest.title: add support for keyboard teleop the hands

content.raw: I'm only seeing 4 hand joints instead of 5 in the modified file.  Looks like thumb roll was left out.  There may be no need for thumb roll, but it makes the joint ordering off by 1.  For example, you have the right joint index 0 maximum value set to 0.55, but shouldn't it be 1.4, as joint 0 corresponds to thumb roll?  Joint index 1 (thumb pitch) max is 0.55, etc.
content.html: I'm only seeing 4 hand joints instead of 5 in the modified file. Looks like thumb roll was left out. There may be no need for thumb roll, but it makes the joint ordering off by 1. For example, you have the right joint index 0 maximum value set to 0.55, but shouldn't it be 1.4, as joint 0 corresponds to thumb roll? Joint index 1 (thumb pitch) max is 0.55, etc.

pullrequest.title: add support for keyboard teleop the hands

content.raw:
Yes, we left the thumb roll out. I added another commit (#!/osrf/srcsim/commits/62a7270457789674d637bada98e070c05799826c?at=default) which adds another key to control the thumb roll (and maps the hand reset command to a different key to make room for the thumb roll - end of keyboard almost reached...).

All joints use very conservative limits to avoid instabilities. Please feel free to suggest higher limits for specific joint if they work stable for you in a pull request.

Even without the thumb roll the code was not using the wrong offset afaik (the `joint_index: 0` in `HAND_BINDINGS` doesn't map to the first joint in the ROS message). The first joint value in the ROS message was just filled with a constant value. All controlled joints followed afterwards but kept their correlation of the key / joint / limit.
content.html:
Yes, we left the thumb roll out. I added another commit (#!/osrf/srcsim/commits/62a7270457789674d637bada98e070c05799826c?at=default) which adds another key to control the thumb roll (and maps the hand reset command to a different key to make room for the thumb roll - end of keyboard almost reached...).

All joints use very conservative limits to avoid instabilities. Please feel free to suggest higher limits for specific joint if they work stable for you in a pull request.

Even without the thumb roll the code was not using the wrong offset afaik (the joint_index: 0 in HAND_BINDINGS doesn't map to the first joint in the ROS message). The first joint value in the ROS message was just filled with a constant value. All controlled joints followed afterwards but kept their correlation of the key / joint / limit.
